meanings.sent1: After the fish stole the bait, I rebaited the hook.
meanings.sent2: He rebaited the trap to catch more mice.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel rebaited the trap with nuts, hoping to outsmart the clever mouse.
meanings.sent4: She rebaited her argument with stronger evidence.
meanings.sent5: The angler rebaited the hook with a juicy worm, ready to catch a big fish.

meanings.definition: To renew the bait on a fishing hook.
meanings.sent1: Before casting the line, he rebaited the hook with fresh worms.
meanings.sent2: She rebaited the hook with a shiny lure to attract more fish.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman rebaited the hook, hoping for a bigger catch this time.
meanings.sent4: He rebaited the hook, luring in the elusive trout.
meanings.sent5: After the fish stole the bait, he rebaited the hook with a tastier treat.

meanings.definition: To renew a trap with fresh bait.
meanings.sent1: The pest control officer rebaited the mousetrap with cheese.
meanings.sent2: She rebaited the trap with peanut butter to attract the rodents.
meanings.sent3: The clever mouse managed to steal the bait even after she rebaited the trap.
meanings.sent4: He rebaited the trap, determined to catch the sneaky raccoon.
meanings.sent5: After the bait was gone, she rebaited the trap with a more enticing snack.
